title: Boiling Oceans on Icy Moons
summary: Scientists have found that some icy moons in our solar system might have oceans that can boil. These moons, like Enceladus, have icy shells covering their insides. When the ice melts into water, the moon shrinks a little because water is denser than ice. This shrinking creates low pressure under the ice shell. On small moons, this low pressure can make the ocean water boil, even if it's cold. Boiling releases bubbles of gas from the water. This happens because small moons have weak gravity. The study helps us understand how moons change over time and could affect if they can support life. It's exciting to learn about these distant worlds and their hidden oceans.

keywords.explanation: a large body of water under the ice on a moon
when liquid turns into bubbles and gas because of low pressure
a natural object that orbits a planet, like Earth's moon
the force that pulls things together, like keeping us on Earth
the push or squeeze on something, like air pressure
the hard, frozen outer layer of a moon

questions.question: What can cause oceans on icy moons to boil?
Which moon is mentioned as having geysers?
What happens when water boils on a small moon?
options: It turns to steam and disappears

questions.question: Why do small moons have boiling oceans?
What is the ice shell made of?
How does melting ice affect the moon's size?

background_read: Icy moons are found around planets like Jupiter and Saturn. They have frozen surfaces, but scientists think there might be liquid water oceans underneath. Water can exist as liquid even in cold places if there's enough pressure or heat. Gravity is the force that holds moons together and affects pressure. When ice melts into water, it takes up less space, which can change the pressure inside the moon. This article talks about how these changes might make water boil on small moons, which is important for understanding if life could exist there.
Article_Structure: WHO: Scientists and researchers studying icy moons
WHAT: Oceans under ice can boil due to low pressure from melting
WHERE: On small icy moons in the outer solar system
WHY: To understand how moons change and if they could support life

perspectives.description: Researchers use models to show how melting ice causes boiling on small moons.
This helps plan future space missions to look for signs of life.
